intro: Beloglottis hameri, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, dense fronds that resemble a star shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Beloglottis hameri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated as a houseplant in many parts of the world.
